availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: David F. Wolf (Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, brewer and city councilman.)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, brewer and city councilman. Native of Germany. Married to Julia Amelia Wolf. Father of Charles E. Wolf. Frederick W. Wolf, and Ella S. Wolf. Brewer in Lexington in 1860. Elected to the Lexington City Council in 1862. Member of the Lexington City Council in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 156.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette, Lexington Ward 3, p. 293A.
"D. F. Wolf Dead," The Daily Leader (Lexington, KY), September 17, 1896, p. 8.
"Lexington City Election," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), January 9, 1862, p. 1.
"D Frederick Wolf (Unknown-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial 98812130, accessed December 5, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/98812130.
